snippet.textDisplay: I dunno, maybe there weren’t any actors of color worth nominating this year. You can’t have 20 nominees.

snippet.textDisplay: Theres no conspiracy to keep people of colour out of the nominations. Theres no conspiracy to keep women out of the nominations of any category. Theres no conspiracy to marginalise any race. A lot of folks seem to lead empty lives so much so that they imagine that they are being kept down. Theyre not. There is no "Man" there is no Illuminati secretly conspiring against you, and there is no patriarchy.   Do incredible work and it will get noticed, regardless whether you are a man or woman, whether youre black or white, whether youre a Jew or a gentile. There is no enemy, at least not one made of flesh.
snippet.textOriginal: Theres no conspiracy to keep people of colour out of the nominations. Theres no conspiracy to keep women out of the nominations of any category. Theres no conspiracy to marginalise any race. A lot of folks seem to lead empty lives so much so that they imagine that they are being kept down. Theyre not. There is no "Man" there is no Illuminati secretly conspiring against you, and there is no patriarchy.   Do incredible work and it will get noticed, regardless whether you are a man or woman, whether youre black or white, whether youre a Jew or a gentile. There is no enemy, at least not one made of flesh.

snippet.textDisplay: These comments are atrocious... Smmfh. But, let it be known and said, we know why "you people" are the way you are, like mr. Phoenix said... It's clearly privilege. Black kids want to eat off those great industry checks too. The oppression reeks. Made this man call it out at the BAFTAs. Anyhow, reparations are not handouts. The bill for what happened in the south is still running untapped and not going anywhere... It's accumulating EVERYDAY. It's overdue. You people received  "handouts" from my people already. Black blood sweat and tears... Your treacherous people would not have it any other way. So...

snippet.textDisplay: Isn't he supposed to be thanking people and getting off the stage. That's why I no longer watch these awards shows. You used to be able to enjoy them. The actors would win their awards. they would come up on stage and give their acceptance speech, They'd thank who they needed to thank, sometimes they were serious and crying, sometimes they were funny, but never did they come up and give long political rants about racism, or global warming, or politics in general. It was fun to watch. Now it's nothing but pure leftist bullshit.
snippet.textOriginal: Isn't he supposed to be thanking people and getting off the stage. That's why I no longer watch these awards shows. You used to be able to enjoy them. The actors would win their awards. they would come up on stage and give their acceptance speech, They'd thank who they needed to thank, sometimes they were serious and crying, sometimes they were funny, but never did they come up and give long political rants about racism, or global warming, or politics in general. It was fun to watch. Now it's nothing but pure leftist bullshit.

snippet.textDisplay:
For sama's director and producer is Waad el khateeb(syrian woman)
Grandad was a romantic's director is Maryam Mohajer(iranian woman)
Klaus's producer is Jinko Gotoh(Japanese woman)
1917 has two female producers as well....
These are not useless behind the scenes roles....
In total almost 15 women won technical awards and 7 of them were non-caucasian..
Michael ward won rising star...
Parasite(fully south korean production)won two awards...
Plus:There were countless nominees as well for directors and writers amd producers who were not male or caucasian...
Britain has many minority ethnicities in it most of which are south asian.. and all the citizen groups are nominated at there awards every year...if you want to look for racism..this is not the place..

snippet.textDisplay: Can't always be about skin surely the racist thing can't always be the reason for everything I'm sick hearing it,  maybe this year it was white people who did better and maybe next year it will be a mix of people with different skin colours and the following year so on people who got there awards deserved it regardless of the skin colour I'm failing to see a white person call people racist just because they didn't win a top award sometimes there is a reasonable explanation like your fellow actor did better or your movie wasn't as good, it's not all about skin colours,  just take the award and move on making drama where no drama is needed just to prove you have a voice of some sort next movie hand it to a man or woman of colour and say there you go you take my skript simple

snippet.textDisplay:
Virtue signalling tosser, why didn't he give his award to someone more deserving instead of wokeboring the world? Hollywood are George S#ros's sock puppets and what they have been commanded by S#ros to prevent is any attempt by Trump to impede the torrent of mass migration, more than half a million migrants and "refugees" into Britain alone each and every year since 2002 (read: 2030: Your Children's Future in Islamic Britain by David Vincent) that has transformed the country. Sor#s owns the Left and the Left now owns the world and the Left wants an end to western civilization via population replacement. The last word on S#ros should go to Zero Hedge now that So#os has had them removed from twitter. They said: "All around you, if you look closely enough, you will see the spectre of George S#ros lurking behind the headlines. The caravan, net neutrality, regulating Facebook, the de-platforming of independent media, colour revolutions and election meddling, refugee creation and manipulation, the trolls on Twitter, your blog and YouTube, etc.
All of these things we see in the headlines today are a product of George S#ros’ money and his singular obsession with re-creating the world in his image.

S#ros is edging closer everyday to the villain in Alan Moore’s Watchmen, Adrian Veidt. A man so obsessed with what he saw as humanity’s failures that he took it upon himself to save us from ourselves. He just had to kill millions of people in order to do it." Zero Hedge are now gone from twitter and will soon be flensed from social media, I wonder why?

snippet.textDisplay:
Sadly Joaquin has taken the Hollywood-white-guilt pill. An actor who did his job and got acknowledged for his work complains about other people not being represented in the category he won? First of all, Joaquin, you did great in Joker, nobody doubts your talent and success, it is NOT your job nor it is academy's to control the "race representation" of categories.
If you want to be acknowledged and appreciated and respected, then do your job and awards will come. "actors of colour not welcome here" - camera literally shows black woman in next shot. There is no law saying that "actors of colour are not welcome", quite opposite actually, BAFTA would do anything to get more diverse people for extra woke-points. The ending was also kind of strange - he blamed themselves for racism? Citation needed, when did BAFTA or holywood (recently) acted in a racist way? That would have been in the news within a second! I don't understand why are we even taking an opinion of an actor as a fact anyway.
Just like how Ricky Gervais said – you are in no position to lecture anybody about anything, you are actor, not an average person.
snippet.textOriginal:
Sadly Joaquin has taken the Hollywood-white-guilt pill. An actor who did his job and got acknowledged for his work complains about other people not being represented in the category he won? First of all, Joaquin, you did great in Joker, nobody doubts your talent and success, it is NOT your job nor it is academy's to control the "race representation" of categories. 
If you want to be acknowledged and appreciated and respected, then do your job and awards will come. "actors of colour not welcome here" - camera literally shows black woman in next shot. There is no law saying that "actors of colour  are not welcome",  quite opposite actually, BAFTA would do anything to get more diverse people for extra woke-points. The ending was also kind of strange - he blamed themselves for racism? Citation needed, when did BAFTA or holywood (recently) acted in a racist way? That would have been in the news within a second! I don't understand why are we even taking an opinion of an actor as a fact anyway. 
Just like how Ricky Gervais said – you are in no position to lecture anybody about anything, you are actor, not an average person.

snippet.textDisplay:
White people ALWAYS get offended when you start calling out things that are racist. You get uncomfortable when people mention racism; imagine if you dealt with it. PoC have made generous contributions to this country and this industry and are still not even half as recognized as white folks. How many black people win awards at these major events each year vs the amount of white people that win. Not even that... how about nominations? How many are nominated compared to white people?? What makes y’all so offended when people bring up race?? Why?? Not all, just some .


SN: you could see the white crowd was uncomfortable during his speech.

It is not justified due to what some people's ancestors did hundreds of years ago. Your ansestors sold you out too yet they are kangs and queens?! Wake up!
